After reading both i would definitely reccomend playing through. The story is amazing.
The first one i would rate 10/10, but the second i would give a 9/10 because at first it started to seem like setsumi was just a copy of himeko, by the end this was not the case, but it still seemed like the characters were similar. next the second one seemed like it was repeating the plot from the first one, again by the end this wasnt the case but it took away from the game for me.

Overall they are both very good stories, but the menus and layout wre a bit unclear at first but useable. The pictures dont use the whole screen and only use a square to display, but i got used to it. 

Overall I give the game's story a 10/10, and the quality and layout a 5/10.

Трогательно, печально, безнадежно. 
Если тремя словами описать "Нарциссы". 
Тронуло. Не покидало сравнение, что главные герои как кошки ушли умирать в отдаленное место, но в отличие от кошек ведомые инстинктом, у них есть выбор... дом.. седьмой этаж... или холодный берег - усыпанный белыми январскими нарциссами - острова Акадзава... И... Очень страшно оказаться на месте главных героев. Человек, тварь не бессмертная, в любой момент может умереть, но... обычно не знает, когда покинет этот мир. Больные хосписа знают. Знают, что конец их близок, знают, что у них нет будущего... Каково жить с четким осознанием, того, что скоро умрешь, что на твоем будущем поставлен жирный крест... Каково? Лучше, не знать об этом. Лучше умереть в счастливом неведение, а не смотреть пустыми глазами, потерявшую надежду, Эхо на бесчувственный реальный, но такой прекрасный мир, на лицо Нарцисса.... Лучше, умереть не зная, когда отдашь концы...

对于那些说游戏充满着颓废感情的人，我想说：这个游戏想要传达的内涵绝不是颓废而是通关之后男主角说的话-让活着的人能够更高兴地活下去。
很多人体会不到生活的意义，那是他们没有直面过死亡。《水仙》恰恰是给了我们这样一次特别的感受，我相信有很大一部分人是玩过这款游戏之后才会更加阳光地看向生活。

38958232.review: Absolutely breathtaking story! It uses very few images, to make you use your imagination a lot more than the average visual novel - and that works much better than you would expect! And that's coming from someone who never reads any kind of literature. The lines are short, nicely written & well translated. The audio is a delight, heaps of different & beautifully produced songs & sound effects. If youve been struggling to feel emotion in your life, you need this. It's not a sad tragedy or a tale of utter despair either. It will make you feel, and think about life.

38605988.review:
以下观感仅代表个人意见：（思维混乱的话还请见谅）

1代和2代的故事承接地很自然，当观者随着故事线向过去追溯的时候，会恍然大悟setsumi的一系列言行的根本起源：残忍一点说最悲哀的不过于这三段相似的生死传承——所以，当既定的结局无法改变的话，那么至少在活着的时候，按照自己的意愿去自由地质疑，发现，然后再去原谅所谓的世界吧。每个人的答案不同，但至少最后，她们都成全了自己，也成全了命运。

从HIMEKO在“死别”之前就定下的“生离”原则，到SETSUMI对其最后选择地图远走高飞的确实承诺——她们虔诚地相信命运，却又真切地与之抗争——也许存在本身即为目的，但凭借着有限的自由选择自己的道路，这正是人类灵魂高贵之处吧。

情感细腻地描写，精致的画风，不过就是太过细腻——可能导致我这种心灵粗糙的人无法进一步耐心体会GAL GAME的美妙之处。（笑）

38449500.review:
「みずいろ」等を制作した「ねこねこソフト」のスタッフが作ったプロのフリーノベルゲーム。

内容は分岐のないビジュアルノベル。
なんと1と2が入っていて、それなりのボリュームがある。

テーマは個人的解釈で「命(の使い方)」非常に重いものだが、それをゲーム中は感じさせない演出で、
決めるところで刺さるように撃ち込んでくるのがプロだなぁ、と。

みずいろで挿入歌として使われた「スカーレット」がBGMで使われていたり、
声優さんもねこねこソフト関係のメンツが揃っていて、
プレイした時点ではこういう情報がなかったので「あれ?」と思ったが、やっぱり、と。

ちなみにみずいろ版スカーレットは動画として上げておいたので、
お暇な方はコミュニティの作品に置いてあるので聴いてみて下さい。

1が本編で2がいわゆるエピソード0。
Steamをインストールしたらやるべき無料ゲームの一つと言える。

38372794.review:
Disclaimer: this is a kinetic novel; it really does not matter wheter you do 1st or 2nd first. I did 1st first. Its author advises doing the 2nd before 1st. Story is slow though, but worth it.

[b]Plot:[/b] simple but memorable and beautiful. It does address the issue of life and death (in real life) and suicidal awareness..
[b]Character:[/b] great development and interesting connection between them
[b]Music:[/b] needless to say it's great
[b]Art:[/b] game focuses on vocal to express, so not many CG's, but they are drawn well enough
[b]Price:[/b] free so I would not complain
[b]Effect:[/b] depressing but not to the point of traumatic. It's sad but it's beautiful.

[b]Overall: [/b] highly recommended. It makes me think.

37425764.review: These novels are extremely sad. I cried at the end of the first one, and did my best not to at the end of the second. The stories told here are absolutely heartbreaking, and there is no happy ending, which just makes the final words of the novels even more heartrenching. I recommend these novels to give you some insight on just how horrible it can be to lose hope, but how wonderful it is to live your final moments with those you care about. 37257708.review: I feel that Narcissu's story succeeds at its goal, which is to make the player, or reader, feel the protagonist's sadness and loneliness. However, Narcissu 1st attempts to do so through a bland male protagnist and a flat female protagonist, which makes the first game hard to finish. Thankfully, the second game does an excellent job of showing why the female protagonist acts the way she does, and does so in a way that makes the reader care for her plight and support her decisions. I recommend this game for anyone who enjoys a story about inner turmoil and reflection, and I ask that you try to put up with the misleading first game, which honestly should be considered the framework for the second.

37029875.review:
[h1]“世界已冷酷至极，让我们携手前行”[/h1]
想了很多，这票决定投给水仙。
绝望的回忆，表面是绝望，实际是希望，表面是致郁，实际是治愈。
没有华丽的CG，没有酷炫的系统，没有强大的世界观设定，有的只是简陋的插画，触及心灵深处的音乐，让人窒息的文字，但是它真实，一部galgame能有这些就足矣。

最近突然对抑郁 自杀 消失 孤独字眼感兴趣，可能我也变得奇怪了吧，也想来场说走就走的旅行。
有时突然感觉自己没用时，觉得自己一生都无法改善现状时，想想濑津美，可能我这种自己觉得平常再平常不过的生活她也会向往吧，那我还有什么理由不努力呢？
如果你是人生赢家，整天开开心心无忧无虑的，我不建议你接触水仙系列，因为怕影响你正常的生活。
如果你感到生活迷茫，人生无意义，不妨静下心来，试试这部被安利多次、却依旧略显冷门的作品吧，也许会使人更抑郁，但一定不要有遗憾，就像不要错过这个游戏一样，这个世界虽然不完美，虽然不公平，但至少我们活过，不为别人活过。

推荐顺序：1→2→1、或2→1。2既算前传也算后传。

水仙1+2虽为免费作品，但如果想支持开发商的话，可以购买十周年版Narcissu 10th Anniversary Anthology Project，价格也不贵，虽然不知道何时会出中文，特别是在知道翻译GAL比开发更耗钱之后。

本想有时间认真评论一番水仙，现在只好借Steam大奖简单说几句。

你所给我的5万日元，我已开始使用。
短短960公里的旅程，一个被冰封了22年的心。
最后留下一段属于你我的回忆。
没有美好的选择，没有优美的画面，
也许我们的人生亦是如此，充满让人不愿回想的痛伤。
你并没有控诉人生的不公，也有可能你的心早已麻木。

“呐，你会拉住我吗？“
如果可以再一次选择，我会不顾一切的拉住你,哪怕那有可能只是因为我单方面的任性，哪怕是我一时脑热的冲动，也请让我看着你的脸颊，直到最后一刻。
Narcissu,水仙花。花语....听说是珍爱自己....但,真的是这样吗......我并不相信。
最后的最后，我始终坚信着，濑津美，最后肯定是微笑着的。祈祷，也肯定是为了所有人的。
                                                                                                 致-一段灿烂的故事，一个冬日的回忆

35126785.review:
A game that will definetly move your heart!!
Both stories are sad.. and it's too much like novel that you might wonder "what's the point of making it a game". but I loved it a lot... the soundtrack always spot on!! and the voice acting is lovely... and heartbreaking in the sad scenes.

- Narcissu
A story sabout a unnamed young man who meets a young woman (Setsumi) meeting in the 7th floor, a place where you wait for your death... They later decided that they don't want to die there and their jouney began.... the story is while very simple it can be hard to predict sometimes, and the coversations are very interesting.

The story becomes too sad in the end... but I still felt that thier death had a meaning, that it wasn't all in vain.

- Narcissu 2nd side
Prequel set 7 years before the previous story about a woman Setsumi knew... 2nd side is better in everything!!
Himeko is a very cheerful girl who contrasts Setsumi a lot... I can't express how much I like this game!!

--------------
Recommended if you want a game that moves your heart, makes you sad sometimes but will leave you with things to think of.

34765718.review:
From developer stage-nana and publishers Sekai Project comes Narcissu 1st & 2nd, the story of a girl who has to choose between 7F and home.

This story focuses heavily on disease and suffering, of a girl having to medicate and go through the adverse affects of medication, and going through her life knowing that she will ultimately die.

I wasn’t sure what I expected when I downloaded this novel from Steam, and I went into it very confused at first. I just knew it was rated very positively, but it sat in my Steam library for a long time after downloading it. Finally, today, after realising I really need to clean some games out of my library to make room on my laptop, I decided to finally open this and play it.

What I definitely did not expect was to be moved to tears by a story such as this. It was incredibly moving, and the story really hit me in a lot of places I didn’t know I could be hit emotionally. The artwork in this really helps to move the story along, and the soundtrack as well, is just so beautiful, it really helps move the story along, and emit feelings in the reader that honestly made me have goosebumps. I have honestly, never been moved so much by just a simple visual novel – this affected me on the same level an incredibly sat film would.

Stage-nana did incredibly well with this story, and I would love to see more from this, and them.

今年是水仙发布的十周年。全成就也刚好拿到，为我心中的神作写一篇短评。

34654175.review:
暂且只评价Narcissu 1st
[b] 剧透警告 [/b]

悲剧，就是把美好的东西毁灭给人看吧。

少有的能真正震撼并感动到我的galgame，不，严格来说并不算是个galgame，没有分支选项，没有精美的cg，只是个由简单的图片，文字，bgm以及配音组成的视觉小说，流程也仅三个多小时，但短短的流程却让我玩完后心里久久不能平静，想哭却哭不出来，不知是为悲剧结局感到难过，还是感慨于最后濑津美面对不公命运的淡然。由于只有很简单的图片，所以很大部分场景也只能靠脑补，最后的结局也是如此。

“你希望我拉住你吗？”
伴随着那声冰冷里透露着千愁万绪的“さようなら”，我看见濑津美第一次穿着她用浴巾做的比基尼走向湛蓝的大海，海水逐渐漫过她的头发，她的身影消失在水中，脸上却依然带着微笑……这样，我们960公里的旅程结束了，对我来说是15天，对她则是22年的旅途结束了…至少…在这一切发生之前，我们一起来到了淡路岛见到了美丽的水仙花丛，再一次意识到了自己短暂人生的意义。

“她的血型是O型，名字叫濑津美，22岁，女性…
塑料识别手环的颜色是白色。
这就是属于她的一切。
…但是，我知道。
她其实很喜欢比基尼，比导航系统更加熟悉道路，喜欢车辆，甚至拥有自己的驾照。
尽管总是面无表情，也很少会看我一眼，
但偶尔，也缓篦露出那种好似害羞又好似倔强的神色…
在翡翠色的大海前…
她会兴奋地，喜悦地，宛如偶像明星一般地对着我微笑…
遗憾的是…
她的笑容却仅仅被记录在了一张由一次性相机拍摄的照片中。
…但是…尽管是仅存的一张照片…
……它也是我们所留下的痕迹……”

那是一个高三的午后，那个下午具体已记不太清了，大约是个长长的自习吧。无聊的我，眼看自己地利极好（轮到了教室的角落），便打开手机掏出耳机，想要玩一玩刚下的Gal。
    诶呀，玩什么呢，都有点提不起兴趣呢，诶，这个《水仙》，好像放在手机里蛮久了，要不先把这个通了吧。
    抱着这样敷衍的心情，我打开了它，这个不起眼的小游戏。
    两小时后，躲在高高的书堆后的我，努力抑制着溢满眼眶的泪水，以免它夺眶而出。
    两年之后，无意间在Steam发现《Narcissu》的我，抑制不住自己重温的欲望，并忍不住为它写下这样的评价：
    这是一款极为优秀的，可以称为我见过最优秀视觉小说，甚至是最优秀文字冒险游戏的作品。在《Narcissu》初见震撼人心的剧情背后，也许更引发人思考的也许是这样一个问题：人面对命运施加的，无可违抗的不幸，到底应该拿出怎样的态度和行动去应对？
    两年前的我，不明白自己为了什么这样震撼；两年后的我，看清了困扰我的这个问题，却给不出最好的答案；我也不知何时的我，面对着濑津美的质问，能坚定地说出

Narcissu - 萌娘百科 万物皆可萌的百科全书
《Narcissu》是由Stage NaNa创作的一部同人游戏，共有三部。
作为一部AVG，Narcissu并没有传统的分支选项与多项剧情。即使是在Narcissu 3中，玩家能做的也只是做出有限的五个选项。
https://zh.moegirl.org/Narcissu
Steam 上的 Narcissu 1st & 2nd  http://store.steampowered.com/app/264380/Narcissu_1st__2nd/
Steam 上的 Narcissu 10th Anniversary Anthology Project  http://store.steampowered.com/app/426690/Narcissu_10th_Anniversary_Anthology_Project/
水仙 Narcissu 1st & 2nd 正版可用汉化补丁 - 华语汉化 - SteamCN 蒸汽动力 - 驱动正版游戏的引擎！  
https://steamcn.com/t131270-1-1
使用方法
解压缩后覆盖游戏同名文件，运行游戏，选择日语。（如果选择英语也许会有bug出现）
成就攻略
分别开启语音和关闭声音通关水仙1和水仙2，可解锁4个成就。然后主界面点击EPILOGUE，然后通关，可解锁最后一个隐藏成就。
小提示，选择开启语音，然后按住Ctrl可快速通关，然后选择关闭语音，直接选最后一个章节，按住Ctrl快速通关，能数分钟内全成就达成。然而我还是建议完整的看一遍剧情。

33877665.review:
这是一款真正的vn，没有选择支，也没有萌妹子或是恋爱剧情，只是讲述了几名绝症患者如何度过自己最后的时光。整个故事的气氛有着人之将死的宁静，也涌动着由于将至的死亡带来的凝重，焦躁，怀念与悲伤。细心的品味这样独特的氛围，走进面临死亡或见证他人走向死亡的主人公们的内心，是本作主要的内容所在。
本作并未对生与死的意义做过多的探讨，或许比起探讨其本身的意义所在，探讨如何面对死亡才更有现实意义。在本作中，玩家可以见证主人公走向死亡的过程和她的内心活动，在看着角色迎来死亡的过程中，也许自己也会反省【如果自己有一天也将成为死者或死亡的见证者，那时该怎么办】这样的问题吧。个人觉得，能引导玩家有这样的思考过程，即是本作最大的意义。
另外值得一提的是，也许是出自有意，在该作品中，亲人和爱人的角色都是相对比较缺失的。无论是1st还是2nd，主人公濑津美和姬子死亡的见证人都是从前素不相识的陌生人，而主人公的父母，恋人则并未出现。或许作者是想要纯粹地探讨【死亡】这个话题吧，又或者，为了避免感情的表现过于浓重，破坏了营造好的气氛。不论如何，父母和恋人的缺省，个人觉得，是该作品之所以是该作品的理由，也是最大的特点。
另外，本作的音乐质量非常优秀，不仅和剧本本身契合度很高，也非常有单独听的价值。dlc中有售卖本作的ost，虽然网易云也有完全一样的东西，不过如果玩过感觉有爱，还是建议支持一下。（毕竟都免费玩过本体了嘛怎么也得意思一下233333）
本作的缺点也不是没有，过于远古而且简陋的画风（尤其是1st），以及在场景转换时bgm会戛然而止让人感觉特别不舒服甚至出戏等等。不过考虑到本身剧本和音乐的高质量，瑕不掩瑜，这些不足也是可以忽略的。
以上。建议一切对vn（galgame）有兴趣的玩家都玩一玩该作品。你绝对不会后悔。

33770891.review: 果然是好作品。虽然目前只看了第一部，但是果然不辜负我半夜来看的期望。好作品都应该半夜来看的，可能也就是只有我这样了吧？故事讲述一个要死了的人和另一个快死了的人通过一次意外的冒险而夺回那些自己想追求的事物的故事。要死的那个一直以为快死的那个是有追求的，但是快死了的那个却一直傲娇说自己大彻大悟，无欲无求。最后要死的那个就带着快死的那个随便找了个事物用来追求。可是仔细想想的话，快死的那个真的无欲无求的话，就没必要跟着要死的那个了。最后在最初那个放弃了的愿望的形态下，真正无欲无求，也无法再向这个世索取什么了的情况下，走向了虚无。可以说剧情上，很虐，但完全没有泪点可言。感觉妙不可言，明明在将死状态下却依然会在意“无意义”的细节，面对绝望时期待着可以将冒险延续下去的男主，一开始便抱持着悲观情绪最后爆发的女主，各个方面都很完美，可以说是不可错过的佳作，只是让我不明白的是这样的故事，二部都会讲些什么？明明该说的都已经说了，难道是围绕着水仙的含义而引发的新故事？新的主角或者新的故事？不过从第一部的故事，我感觉完全值得期待。

33746855.review:
时隔多年又打开这款游戏，是熟悉的标题页面、是熟悉的BGM，也是熟悉的开头。
记得玩这个游戏的时候还是个刚上初中的小屁孩，转眼间现在就是大学狗了不得不说时间过得真的是太快了。感觉通关这款游戏的那天也没有过去多久，怎么一算却是好几年了呢？
这款游戏可以说是我第一个接触的AVG类游戏了，当时还想，这也算是游戏吗？后来才知道还有一种分类叫做视觉小说....
那时可以一天到晚坐在电脑面前打游戏的热情与精力现在已经没有了（但是能逛STEAM一整天的摸鱼精神还是可以有的）

我还记得当年玩的时候哭的稀里哗啦，我还以为这么多年过去了自己会免疫了呢，今天一打开游戏，听到开头那令人怀念的音乐，我才知道，水仙在我心中从未枯萎（那是当然的吧，毕竟我现在Q名就是因为这个游戏起的=-=）

音乐好听！剧情感人！
生与死、人与命运令人思考，只希望厄运降临至我们身上时，我们都有勇气去面对
对于我而言是10/10的神作！

33641647.review: I've put off reading these stories for a long time. Tough material, stories of terminally ill youth finding meaning in their final days. The package consists of two short stories, with the second part being longer and to me, more emotional. I did find that the writing style and lack of character visuals for reference sometimes made it hard to tell who was saying what lines. But you get multiple translation choices and can play with or without voices so it's easy to experience this just the way you want to. In retrospect, and after seeing the author's comments on this very matter, it may be better to play in the reverse order.

32971510.review:
轻微剧透，请注意
  作为我的启蒙作，时隔多年再次下载并通关日文原版。 
  死亡，多么空洞的词语，却毫无顾忌地来到我们身边。在大海中死去，既是对命运的屈服又是对命运的抗争，无人知晓的女孩留下的是唯一对她有一丝印象的我，而我也终将死去。在大海前，故事的主人公是她，而当她死后，存在的却只有我了。但她是否还存在在何处，亦或者是否能永远记在我的心中直到我死去？核心人物的变化使主题也发生了改变。
  当之无愧的神作，对生与死的讨论的同时也思考着存在与意义，具有不低的哲学性。最终走向死亡并非作者突兀的情感表达或者强行致郁，死亡的结局是从开端看无法改变的，死在何处，都是那样的悲伤，却无法拒绝这个选择。
  但我并不推荐这款游戏作为GAL的入门作品（即使他是免费的），这款严格来说并不算GAL，电子小说的称呼更适合他。对许多人来说，这是一款致郁的作品，需要仔细思考才能理解作者想要表达的东西，以及作者想借此引导的生死思考。而GAL大多是使人感动轻松，让人对（多位）女主角感动喜爱，大量的平凡无奇的日常对话正是GAL的重要特点，优秀的配乐与画面中人物的表情比起文字性叙述更直接的情感表达更是GAL的核心，水仙有的仅仅是经典的BGM与无尽的思考。
  公路片的类型（非欧美作）是我喜爱的类型，相比狼与辛香料的平淡旅程，这条通向水仙与海的道路以完全不同的风格阐述着令人悲伤的故事。故事本身同样精彩，但作者优秀的功底营造的环境更是使人感动伤感。等待死亡的七楼在现实中是否存在？即使没有这么直观明显，我想它也是存在的。在旅途中，两个虚弱的病人只是希望去远方。吸引她的不是水仙也不是大海，她想找的只是现实中并不存在的她的伊甸园。

Are you some masochist wanting to drive your soul into an abyss of FEELZ or simply a curious wanderer who's also a cheapskate after seeing the 'free' pricetag..? 

I'm a mixture of the above and I was pretty curious about how 'visual novels' actually work; and well, it's just that- it's basically a story book with a heart-wrenching narrative and apt music to accompany it. For my first 'visual novel' I was quite impressed. It was like watching an extremely sad anime (which I LOVE).

The music did get a bit repetitive afterwards (maybe I took too long to actually read through it) But damn, the story and everything is just amazing. As a masochist and someone who just loves to get on board the FEELZ train, Narcissu 1st & 2ND definitely hits that spot and I would recommend it to anyone willing to spend some time to read through this short but well-crafted story.

Art: 7/10
Story: 8/10
Music: 7/10

32640006.review:
也不知道自己何时，为何会想到双击点开这个游戏，大概是因为它的游戏封皮给吸引住了吧，也有可能是厌倦了动作类游戏，竞技类游戏那种繁杂的操作和勾心斗角的套路吧，想找个静静的角落自己好好待一下。。
嗯，单调的白底黑字，配上一种说不出感觉单调的画风，Narcissu，这注定是一款充满悲伤基调的视觉小说。三天，读完Narcissu 1st 2nd，两个个主人公的正脸，也只有在终章结束时才能看得见。。。

如果是单纯体验游戏感受来说这游戏的话，根本没什么好说的，别玩了吧。这不是用来娱乐的游戏，而是一部视觉小说。

可以说，这是我第一部通关的视觉小说吧，没有现代画风的任何气息，没有华丽的CG可爱的人物造型，人物间的对话也仅仅用简单的风景图画当作背景画面。但却给了我一种安详的感觉，就想自己一个人静静的把这关于生命的故事给看下去，就这么静静的听着游戏OST，滚动着鼠标滚轮，往下看。
两部小说来讲水仙 第二部才是真正让我泪腺崩溃的故事。主要剧情是讲述濑津美和姬子之间的故事。他们俩之间发生的故事（观看顺序还是按照第一部第二部这种顺序来看更好，因为很多第一部埋下的伏笔都会在第二部中得到答案）..

但第一部也是佳品，在男主人公我的带领下，在这960KM的逃离旅程中,让久郁不治选择逃避的濑津美重新面对自己的人生，让她重新打开自己的心扉的点点滴滴小事件里，也能发现一种温馨而苍白的感动。

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
以下是我最有感触部分文本吧。。

Narcissu 1st

「呐…可以最后回答我一个问题吗？」 

「嗯」 

「你现在…希望我拉住你吗？」 

「还是…希望我鼓励你呢？」 

她在波浪中背对着我停下了脚步。。 

强风将浪头变作飞沫， 
拍打在她的身上。 

慢慢地，她转过身来… 

「…是啊…谁知道呢」 

「呵呵，我自己也不知道哪」 

说着，她对着我，最后又微笑了一次。 

尽管冰冷的飞沫拍打在她的身上，尽管眼中含满了泪水， 
但她仍然对着我微笑了一次。

从前，在浪边停下的脚步… 

这一次，却再也没有停下来。 

…所以，我想，这就是她的回答吧… 

「那么…再见…」  
…就这样，我们９６０ｋｍ的旅途结束了… 

对我来说是１５天， 
对她来说则是２２年的旅途结束了。 

她以自己的意志逃出了７楼与家的选择。 
成为了２００５年度推算自杀者人数３万５千人中的一位。 

她的血型是Ｏ型，名字叫濑津美，２２岁，女性… 
塑料识别手环的颜色是白色。 

这就是属于她的一切。 

…但是，我知道。 

她其实很喜欢比基尼，比导航系统更加熟悉道路， 
喜欢车辆，甚至拥有自己的驾照。 

尽管总是面无表情，也很少会看我一眼， 

但偶尔， 
也会流露出那种好似害羞又好似倔强的神色… 

在翡翠色的大海前… 

她会兴奋地，喜悦地， 
宛如偶像明星一般地对着我微笑… 

遗憾的是… 

她的笑容， 
却仅仅被记录在了一张由一次性相机拍摄的照片中。 

…但是…尽管是仅存的一张照片… 

……它也是我们所留下的痕迹…… 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Narcissu 2nd

「……不要露出这样的表情……」

「你，你露出这样的表情……不是连我也难过起来了吗？」

……如果……我是圣者的话……

如果，我所说出的话……不只是安慰，也不只是骗小孩的魔法……

……真正的魔法的话……

「呜，呜……」

「对不起，姐姐……」

「没成为朋友就好了。」

在不停哭泣的我面前，寂寞地说着道歉的她。

「明明在规则里也有这条……」

「来到这里后，就不能在交朋友了。」

「对不起，如果我有好好遵守的话。」

「……也不会让姐姐哭泣了。」

然后……再次面向天际，开始祈祷的她。

面向着广阔的，一望无际的天空，

向着应该就在那里的……神明献上了祈祷……

真挚的摸样……

将我的十字架拿在手中，

只是主祷文，却相信着是磨法咒文的摸样……

「不，不用了，不用在祈祷了。」

「……为什么？」

「呜，呜……」

「……没用的……就算这样也……」

终于……

终于……身为天主教徒，

说出了不能说出口的话语。

「所，所以停下来吧，你不会得到救助的……」

「不管怎么做……都会死的……」

然后身为陪护……

身为尼洛的挚友阿洛伊斯……

……也说出了不能说出口的话语……

「嗯，我知道的……」

「那……为什么？」

「…………」

「……没什么，我已经没关系了……」

「只是，希望哭泣着的姐姐……停止哭泣而已……」

「……早一点……恢复一如往常的笑容……」

「……只是为了这个而祈祷……」

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

32402176.review:
Some things to note on this one:
It's not a story with 'choices' or 'multiple endings,' it's just a simple read-through, just so you know.
There are two stories here, the 1st is the original story, and the 2nd is a prequel.  It is recommended (by the author) to read the 2nd first, but I didn't catch that until after I read the first one.  Either way works... I thought the 2nd was better than the first, if that matters somehow.
Not that I care too much about it, but the art could be seen as lacking.
The music seemed to fit in pretty well. 
And then we get to the story and characters... This will be tough.

The characters are... not that interesting.  They are bland, to me anyway.  And this usually would be a criticism, but when you go through the story, it makes sense why they are that way.  So, I don't know how to... review this part.  I thought they were boring, and the interactions for the first 90% of the (1st) game are almost cringe-worthy... but I understand why it's that way.  I know this may not make much sense, but take it as you will.  The 2nd story is better with this: some of those characters are pretty interesting (interactions are still a bit weak).

The story is a big 'feels trip,' if you can put yourself in the situations described and imagine it, you will feel strongly about the story, and this is what pretty much makes up for.... everything.  A lot of people praise this, and it certainly made me feel more empathetic at times.  Also, the game is free, so you can give it a few hours of trying it out if you'd like and make a decision as you play.  The story was definitely worth the read.

I, personally, have some issues with the story, but that is of a personal nature: for my review, I'll recommend trying it out and just read above for my 'neutral' take on this.  The rest of what follows is just my personal thoughts/feelings on this.

I felt... that this story 'glorified' or 'romanticized' something that should not be glorified at all.  I know it's a story, and it's expanding one's way of thinking and just a take on things... but I still don't like that at all.  If you read the story, you'll probably guess it rather quickly.

This story also goes into religion somewhat, and presents what I feel is a... one-sided view on things?  I think that's the best way to describe it.  I completely understand why it's included, I know why people feel this way, and I'm sure it's a popular view.  It makes sense with the story.  But it sucks that nothing was really presented to show a different way, a different view to balance this.  So I will post that view here, if you wish to read (spoiler alert though):

[spoiler]
God loves you and cares.  I know it's difficult to understand sometimes, I know it's difficult to see, I know sometimes it does NOT feel that way, and things happen that don't make sense.  It's fine to be mad sometimes.  But He does care, so don't give up on Him.  Or yourself, for that matter.
[/spoiler]

32313010.review:
I'm not really into visual novels, but this one, even don't having choices or interaction, it's, imo., a very meaningful piece of art.

You might think [i]"what's the point of playing a book?"[/i] But this visual novel uses everything to turn the simple read into a great experience, the passing, music and visual choices (like the choose for less, but more significant, area of illustration) are all great in setting the theme and touching the emotional of the reader, in a way that neither a book, audio-book or a pack of illustrations could do by their own. And that's what art is all about, using the media to provoke feelings and thoughts, right?

悲伤之后余留下来在记忆中的 却又是一种温馨得让人不由得想微笑的力量
喜欢一个人最认真的姿态 就是到最后活成了她的样子 或者是她希望的样子吧


[h1] 濑津美的水仙与比基尼	[/h1]

对普通人来说 我的存在只是一个累赘
从那时我的时间 就静止了

你是第几次了 第几次来到七楼了
这是不成文的规矩 那么仔细听我说 我只说一次 接下来的话要仔细听好
第三次暂时出院的时候 就做好心理准备吧 不会再有第四次了 已经无法再回到家里去了
假如想逃走的话 不要到A车站去 而要到B车站去
什么也不要吃 这是最快捷的手段 同时也是减少家人负担的最佳方法

冰冻住时间 冰冻住内心
但是 心口上那道长长的伤痕在奉劝我 劝我放弃这些念头
它在奉劝我 将空想的世界作为余生的伴侣
我有泳装 也有地图 但我却没有未来

我再提最后一个要求 笑一笑吧 濑津美
驾照就当做纪念吧 她从手上取下白色的手环 把它递给了我
你现在希望我拉住你么？

这样我们960公里的旅途结束了 对我来说是15天 对她来说是22年

32264601.review:
她的名字叫濑津美，血型O型，22岁，女性。
她的名字叫姬子，血型AB型，23岁，女性。
她们曾经有过交集，她们都曾有过旅行。
她们有梦，有地图，有裙子与比基尼。
但她们没有未来。

Don't you cry tonight，There's a heaven above you baby，————GunsN' Roses

水仙（Narcissu）曾被评为2005年最佳电子小说，比起GAL，视觉小说更加符合对它的概括。通篇没有任何选项，玩家只能伴随着一行行文字去感受作者描绘出的故事。
在画风上，略有常识的玩家在体验游戏时可能会发现画风有些眼熟。因为担任游戏主要画师的ごとP，作为90年代最早一批使用电脑创作CG的老资格画师，曾担任过麻枝准为CLANNAD所作的官方外传小说的小说插画。2007年京阿尼动画化CLANNAD，相当多的玩家重温小说时对ごとP的小说插画赞不绝口，好评度甚至超过原版游戏樋妈画风[spoiler] （樋妈：明明是我先）	[/spoiler]，即使是动画版的画风也与ごとP小说插画相接近，可见其深入人心程度。
脚本方面，作为脚本构成的片岡とも，除水仙以外，也担任过《120円の春》，《银色》两部名作的脚本，功力不言而喻。值得一提的是，故事本身是一个充斥悲伤的直面死亡的过程，观看过程中却完全不会感到绝望。制作者在感想中提过：“这次试着努力避免从渐渐虚弱到死的描写”，与游戏结尾不谋而合。制作选了一个充满绝望的题材，却给人讲述了一个平静，充满希望的故事，在表达情感与故事表现力间取得了一个微妙的平衡。
除了脚本以外，与游戏紧密贴合的BGM功不可没。在恰当的时间表达出恰当的情感，与故事融为一体却不会喧宾夺主。游戏中的BGM都是值得通关后反复复习的精品。但是制作者对于BGM原设定是三秒渐逝，似乎由于兼容性等多方面原因导致切换断片，制作人也在附录里表达了抱歉。虽然可以原谅但也未免可惜。偶尔的出戏在所难免。

PS：2代过场的无名小女孩，CV是能登。

[spoiler] 让活着的人，笑着走下去。	[/spoiler]值得一阅的，充满希望的平淡故事。

32138585.review:
Salut voici mon avis sur  Narcissu 1st & 2nd :

Bien que le jeu soit en anglais, il est très compréhensible si on a un niveau correct et est gratuit. Non, je ne devrais pas parlé de jeu mais d'histoire textuelle (light novel sans choix), un petit roman pleins de sentiments qui vous fera réfléchir et vous fera voir et comprendre ce que ressentent ceux qui sont condamné à mourir dans quelques semaines.

J'ai été littéralement transporté dans ce jeu, me tenant au coté de ces deux personnages, différent l'un et l'autre : l'un est une fille de 22 ans, pas bavarde et rêveuse, l'autre un garçon de 21 ans, plus social. Mais un point commun les réunirent : Ils vont tous les deux mourir. Ne supportant ni l'hôpital, ni leurs propres maisons, ils décident de s'enfuirent et de trouver un endroit où la fille veut mourir.

Nos deux protagonistes vont parcourir plus de 900km à travers le Japon, alternant des moments heureux, de paix et des moments de confusion, de larmes et de détresse.

L'ambiance sonore est parfaitement gérée par des musiques et des doublages de hautes qualité et nous immerge complètement dans le jeu. Les décors, quant à eux, sont beaux et soignés. L'histoire est triste et au fur et à mesure qu'on avance dans celle-ci, on en apprend plus sur les personnages ce qui fait qu'on s'attache à eux.

Pour les épisodes, il vous faudra environ deux heures pour finir le premier, et une bonne dizaine pour le deuxième ce qui fait une très bonne durée de vie pour un jeu gratuit. Bref, une merveille qu'il faut absolument essayer. Je vous le recommande vivement.

P.S : la fille aurait put avoir un corps plus féminin pour une femme de son âge, ce que je veux dire par là un corps avec des formes plus généreuses et aussi qu'elle fasse moins gamine...lool

31999719.review:
"人活一世，草木一春。"生命各有长短，但是死亡终会作为生的一部分，伴随生的结束而到来，这是自然的规律。

但是当你得知自己将要死了的时候，你会哭吗？亦或是平静接受呢？
也许会记起很多没能实现的愿望，或回想起过去生活中的遗憾，又或想起以前同行过却又慢慢回归各自人生轨道的人们。
如果有的选，当然是想要继续活下去啊，可惜没有给你选择的余地，你的时间已经不多了。
你可以出于恐惧选择哭泣，因为你害怕失去那些人生历程中宝贵的东西；
也可以平静的接受死亡的判决，去做人生最后的挣扎，留下自己存在过的证明。
无论怎么选择，死亡终会带来平息。


一朵水仙，两段故事。
片冈老师带给我们的不止是感动，还有对死亡这个严肃话题的探讨。

故事的叙述方法并不出众，甚至有点平淡，但是却极具感染力，随着故事的推动我的心境产生了很大的变化，从[spoiler]两人出逃后，海边津赖美的那句“你会拉住我吗？”的[/spoiler]治愈，到[spoiler]第一章节结束，由主角陈述津赖美22年人生结束时的[/spoiler]致郁，再又[spoiler]被最后姬子和津赖美在雨后山中的关于生死的对话感染[/spoiler]重归平静。生与死都有它的定数，除了接受，别无他法。

而且配乐和文本契合度相当高，配乐给故事加了很多分。


同时推荐一部摩根·弗里曼出演的电影《遗愿清单》。

31333449.review:
Well, first... let me just explain my surprise and what grey areas there are in calling something a "Visual Novel". 

I know that, as far as credibility among gamers go, visual novels are among the lowest, most "casual" rung in reputations. However, there are some games I enjoy very much which are often referred to as visual novels. [i]Ace Attorney[/i]. [i]Danganronpa[/i]. To an extent, [i]The Walking Dead[/i], though it is more commonly referred to as something along the lines of an "interactive movie". Even some rpgmaker games, such as the line of games: [i]To The Moon[/i], [i]A Bird Story[/i], and, I assume, the coming sequel [i]Finding Paradise[/i]. 

But the thing is... these "visual novels" normally come with some kind of interactivity. Moving around, examing objects, quick-time events, dialogue options, even some mini-games. They gain the title of "visual novel" from the intense focus on story and that, at times, all you can do to advance the story is to continuously press the button to move to the next line. But they have other features. [i]Narcissu[/i], on the other hand, does not.

That is what surprised me about [i]Narcissu[/i]... That there was literally no gameplay and you just clicked your way through all portions of the story. I'm not going to hold this against the game. It was clearly tagged as such under "visual novel". I'm simply used to, I guess, games that are in the same realm as visual novels, but not quite. So I had a hard time maintaining interest. That, however, does not mean I regret reading through the story. 

[i]Narcissu 1st[/i] I found exceptionally compelling. The thoughts of life and death are rather similar to my own. The tedium from inaction at the thought of wasting away in a hospital, terminally ill. The unbreakable spirit in doing what you want in life and dying on your own terms. Every person's right to die when they want or feel they need to die. I found myself to be rather fond of Setsumi's perspective. [i]Narcissu 2nd[/i] wasn't a bad expansion upon the characters, but it is longer and I didn't feel as interested. However, the epilogue ties things up nicely. 

I kind of liked this story, and I loved the sentiment behind it. As long as you know ahead of time that this is a true Visual Novel, then there would be no reason not to enjoy it. And if you're the emotional type, bring some tissues.

由于我个人对于音乐的要求有些苛刻与不同，我认为在gal中来讲这种BGM只是一般水平
所以我在游玩过程中都是选取了自己的曲子来听，以下是音乐列表
Safe and sound—Capital city
Pompeii—The Bastille
There Must Be More To Life Than This (William Orbit Mix)—Queen
The show must go on—Queen

在第二篇的时候，我加入了一些新的曲子

死公主的孔雀舞
cocoon—林友树

其实与其说这是个游戏，不如说这是一个向你展示一个故事的程序，也就是标签中的视觉小说
整个故事都在一种阴冷的色调中进行，低沉但并不是死寂，灰暗但不让人恐惧，讲述了女主角佐仓濑津美在生命最后的几年中经历的故事，
因为这里涉及到剧透，我就不继续写了，写一些关于整个故事的想法，
有人可能注意到了，我在体验故事的时候听的Safe and sound显得画风有点不一样，这是有原因的，因为我曾设想过，假如让我去做一个友人（也有可能是恋人）分别的故事，在他们分开时，我会用什么曲子呢，我觉得就是这首Safe and sound莫属，歌词里的

even the sky is falling down,I know there we'll be safe and sound
就算天塌了下来，我也知晓我们将平安无虑

这种祝福，难道不是对一场分别最好的寄语吗，
也许濑津美到最后最需要的不是祝福吧，但我作为第四堵墙外的人，最多也只能做到这一步了，

最后濑津美的选择，让我想起了维克多·埃米尔·弗兰克尔的“人类的终极自由”，即
自我意识是独立的，可以超脱于肉体束缚之外。也就是说，在刺激与反应之间，人本身还有选择如何反应的自由与能力
人的一生终究是有一死的，生死的问题必将困扰着一个人的一生，我们在死亡来临前，压倒的恐惧与焦虑前，我们还能选择什么又能去反应什么，这个问题的答案将决定我们最后的日子将如何结束，一个人的生总是无法选择的，但你走运的话，至少可以选择如何在未来里去死的方式，若不在脑子好使的时候仔细想清这个问题，在以后的日子还总带着这个未解的问题，至少于我而言，是不会太好过的。

也许是我有宗教信仰的关系吧，在注定的死之前，我觉得毋须害怕担忧，因为我深知我的上师三宝会帮助我渡过难关，而我父亲对我的教育也是很有作用，他在很早的时候就一直给我讲，没有人陪伴了我一辈子，我终将自己一人活在这世上，所以我自己是不会担心到生者与死者的永别将是如何的痛苦与难舍，万物有始有终，接受就好了。

其实在玩了2之后，我觉得濑津美最后的自杀真的很自私，她的生命对于她的家来讲，是意义非凡的，她的家人为她做出了相当多的改变与牺牲，而她的选择却是如此的潦草，她自己轻易地走了，而为她炸土豆烧伤了手的妈妈会怎么觉得？她的家庭不像男主那样冷漠无情，明明有着诉说的余地，为什么要这样擅自地就去做出决定啊[spoiler] 所以艹他妈编剧脑子他妈的有病，这个线索很明显前后对不上啊！！[/spoiler]

现在仍然沉浸在对于这部作品的余震中，推荐一部电影，兔子洞，一个孩子的死对于周围的人来说，到底会是怎样的影响
另外在这种对于死亡的思考中，以及对于网易云那个傻逼翻译的不满，我把woodkid 的iron重新翻译了一次，也放在这里分享一下吧

Deep in the ocean, Dead and cast away
亡入死海深渊之地
Where innocence is burned, In flames
无罪纯净焚毁殆尽
A million mile from home, I'm walking ahead
背井万里 孑然一人前行
I'm frozen to the bones, I am......
切身刺骨激寒 吾感
A soldier on my own, I don't know the way
为无主之兵卒 道无以知
I'm riding up the heights of shame
翻身耻辱羞愧 皆尽背后
I'm waiting for the call, The hand on the chest
静候召唤 祈祷行礼心前
I'm ready for the fight, And fate
吾身无谓争战天命
The sound of iron shots is stuck in my head
梦里剑戟枪鸣未息
The thunder of the drums dictates
雷鼓宣号三振
The rhythm of the falls, The number of dead's
错落殒律哀落 死者恒河沙计
The rising of the hoards, Ahead
举头往升无数聚集
From the dawn of time to the end of days
昼夜流连向须臾
I will have to run, Away
犹欲奔走远去
I want to feel the pain and the bitter taste
心念痛苦又于身心
Of the blood on my lips, Again
再将血迹在唇间际
This steady burst of snow is burning my hands,
不散霜雪冻烧十指
I'm frozen to the bones, I am
切身刺骨激寒吾感
A million mile from home, I'm walking away
背井万里 孑然一人前行
I can't remind your eyes,Your face

30838098.review:
Представьте, каково это, жить в тесной палате, каждый день смотреть в окно, видеть бурлящую вокруг жизнь, видеть огромный мир по ту сторону стекла и не иметь возможности прикоснуться, почувствовать? Каково каждый день, снова и снова, проходить через бесконечный цикл из уколов, процедур и проверок? Каково быть окружённым людьми, которым нет до тебя дела, которые скорее всего даже не помнят твоего имени? Осознавать, что когда-то у тебя была своя жизнь, полная ярких красок и эмоций, были друзья, были мечты и устремленья. Каково понимать, что этого уже не вернуть, чувствовать пустоту внутри себя, чувствовать боль и отчаяние и быть окружённым такими же обречёнными, как ты? Каково продолжать жить, не имея надежды?

Это история про живых, которым ничего не остается, кроме как умереть и умирающих, которым ничего не остается, кроме как жить дальше.

Эта простая история о многом, что мы предпочитаем не замечать…

И конечно же… Это история о девушке, чье сердце остановилось, и о молодом человеке, чье дыхание вот-вот оборвется…

30656638.review:
♥ Français en dessous ! ♥

My review may have a "knowledge bias", but I didn't like this kinetic novel (kinetic meaning you have no choice to make) for its lack of accuracy. It is a very liked game so I know I might face a shitstorm, but well...

I have heavy chronic diseases, and I worked in a hospital  before having to stop working.
This kinetic novel (two stories) is about young people who know they will die, and just wait for their end in a special floor in a hospital (... or try to give life a sense one last time). 
Well, even if they will die, as hospital staff you don't let people watering flowers under a hard sunny sky, or just fooling around like they want. Hospital is not a hostel. You never, ever, let drugs in a hospital without watch and being locked with a key, you never have a floor with just no staff around.
When you are really sick (and even more when you will be dead soon), you can't f♥♥♥ing take care of flowers under the sun, you just vomit because you can't stand the weather anymore. You can't drive, because you are so tired you can not even read, or think. You can't walk a mountain (!!), because just walking a bit makes you feel dizzy. No matter how hard your will, how high your spirit, your body stays broken. So you try to reflect on life, to be with your close ones, to be happy for your last moments, while being in your bed, in your room, because that's all you can do.
And as a reader, I don't know how to feel empathy with a girl just saying "betsu ni" during 80% of her story, with all the little things you learn about her having a root in the second story (a prequel) like this girl never had family, friends, influences, character in her life before that; and I can't stay focused on a story with so many false things and just have the clear attempt to make you cry. (oh, and also, I have a strong Faith. Well, some Catholic people seems to have been touched by the way the topic is touch on this story; but I didn't as well, it wasn't deep enought, philosophically and emotionally, for me).

It's just a novel by, and about, normal people who won't die (and never worked in a hospital), thinking of how it would be to die soon and young. You may get the feels if you don't know anything of it, but if you are in this case, it just feel untrue and a bit pathetic.

Some good points for this game:
- good voice acting.
- free.
- easy tophies for trophies hunters.

That's all. HF.

♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥
Frenchy French time !

Bon, donc pour commencer, j'ai des biais "de connaissance" qui expliquent sans doute mon impression négative pour ce kinetic novel (histoire visuelle sans choix à faire, juste lire, écouter et passer les pages), aussi aimé soit-il: j'ai des maladies chroniques bien handicapantes, et avant de tomber malade, je bossais dans un hôpital. Et je me suis dit qu'avoir un avis "de l'intérieur" pouvait être intéressant.

Du coup, mon avis sur le jeu est confronté à la réalité. Par exemple:
- Quand on bosse dans un hôpital, jamais un étage n'est laissé sans aucun personnel. On ne laisse jamais les médicaments sans surveillance, et sans être dans des armoires fermées à clef. On ne laisse personne aller et venir librement, même s'ils vont bientôt mourir -bonjour la surveillance des constantes vitales- et encore moins faire des choses comme aller arroser des fleurs en plein cagnard.
- Quand on est très malade (et encore plus quand on est à quelques semaines de mourir, hein.), on ne va pas arroser les fleurs en plein aprem l'été, parce qu'on ne supporte plus les températures et on est trop occupé à vomir. On ne peut pas conduire, parce que la plupart du temps on est déjà trop fatigué(e) pour comprendre un livre, et même penser des fois c'est limite. On ne va pas faire des balades en pleine montagne (......) parce que même marcher un peu donne des vertiges. Peu importe le moral, le mental qu'on a, ça ne répare pas le corps magiquement (malheureusement). Alors on essaie de réfléchir à sa vie, d'être avec ses proches, de régler ses papiers, de profiter du temps qui nous reste, dans notre lit, notre chambre, parce qu'il ne reste que ça.

Après, on peut me dire "ouiii, mais c'est une histoire, c'est touchant". Ouais, sauf que quand on "connaît", on est sans cesse choqué(e) par le fait que... c'est une histoire écrite par des gens qui vont bien (et n'ont jamais bossé dans un hôpital), sur des gens qui vont bien en fait, mais qui s'amusent juste à imaginer ce que ça ferait de mourir jeune et bientôt. C'est juste une histoire plein de choses pas vraies, pas cohérentes, dans le but de faire pleurer.
En tant que lectrice, je ne vois pas comment m'attacher à un personnage qui passe son temps à dire "betsu ni" ("rien de spécial") 80% de son histoire, et qui en plus pour le peu de caractère qu'elle a, tient tout de l'héroïne de la seconde histoire (une préquelle) comme si elle n'avait elle-même jamais eu de famille, d'amis, d'influence d'aucune sorte ni même de caractère avant de la rencontrer. Personnage bien construit donc. En tant que personne ayant une forte spiritualité, même si certains Catholiques semblent avoir été touchés par la seconde histoire, pour moi ce n'était pas assez profond ni philosophiquement, ni émotionnellement.

Bref, une histoire lente, pas crédible, pas creusée. Il faut ne pas connaître pour de vrai ces sujets pour être touché(e), honnêtement. 

Mais je vais donner quand même quelques points positifs (juste, pas du tout suffisants, pour moi, pour mériter une recommandation):
- le doublage est très bien fait, et le jeu est de bonne qualité.
- gratuit.
- trophées ultra-faciles pour les chasseurs.

Et c'est tout. Amusez-vous bien.

30581184.review:
Ich habe gerade mal knapp eine Stunde gespielt und muss sagen, dass es mir jetzt schon sehr gut gefällt.
Die Musik ist einfach unfassbar fantastisch und man merkt schnell was für eine traurige/krasse story hinter dem ganzen steckt. 
Zwar ist es auf der Visuellen Ebene echt nichts krasses und man bekommt nur diese kleinen Bilder zu sehen die (zumindest bisher) meisst ziemlich unspannend sind. Die wundervolle Musik gleicht das aber ziemlich aus und...ja man sollte sowas eben wirklich wegen der Story spielen und nicht großartig wegen den Bildern. Für Grafik kann man dann gerne Animes gucken, aber ich finde es hier nicht sehr schlimm. Man muss auch immernoch bedenken, dass es kostenlos ist und, dass es von 2007 ist.

Bin auf diese Teile übrigens durch den 3. Teil gekommen, da dort viele gemeint haben, dass der 3. Teil hauptsächlich was für Fans des 1. und 2. Teiles ist. Wenn die Story dort auch gut ist/bleibt und die Grafik im 3. auch ein wenig interessanter ist (wahrscheinlich auch wenn nicht) kann ich mir gut vorstellen mir den 3. Teil zu kaufen.

Probiert es einfach mal aus, immerhin ist es ja kostenlos! Für mich ist es die 2. Visual Novel, wobei ich bei der ersten (Sweetest Monster) auch erst sehr wenig Spielzeit habe.

Achja was das Englisch angeht: Ich muss mit den Englisch-Kentnissen die man bis Klasse 9 so hat und die ich bei meinem Dasein im Internet so erlangt habe schon immer wieder mal den Übersetzer nutzen, allerdings ist das meisstens nicht zwingen nötig, sondern nur wenn mans ganz genau wissen will. Mit dem meissten komme ich also klar (im gegensatz zu "Sweetest Monster", da ist es sehr viel mehr "Fach-Englisch".

LG :)

30572895.review:
Una delle novel più toccanti in cui mi sia mai imbattuto. 

Installata giusto per curiosità data la sua natura gratuita e i molti pareri positivi, me ne sono davvero innamorato in poco tempo. Ho apprezzato in particolar modo Narcissus 2nd, sorta di prequel della storia originale, che pur affrontando le medesime tematiche della prima offre una visione più ampia e meno circonstanziata, con un cast più allargato ed assortito e personaggi, a mio giudizio, meglio caratterizzati ed empatici. Ma resta solo una mia particolare preferenza, dettata probabilmente anche da una maggior aspetto "moe" che la permea rispetto alla più fredda e laconica Narcissus 1.

Sia come sia si tratta di un'opera che, pur non brevissima come ci si potrebbe aspettare (circa 10 ore di gameplay), vale assolutamente la pena giocare. 

Bei personaggi, storia toccante, buon ritmo, tanti *FEELS* , comparto grafico molto gradevole, e una OST a dir poco magnifica e che potrete ascoltare a piacimento tramite il comodo jukebox integrato una volta terminata la novel.

Cosa si può volere di più? Ah si. Narcissus 3rd ovviamente :D

30037642.review:
剧情上分了多个章节来讲述不同的事情，每个章节里都有一个很明确的内容，虽说 chap1 就已经告诉了最终结果，但是中间每个章节发生的事情还是能激起个人「曾经想要尝试却未曾尝试的感觉」也挺好的。
bgm 上可以当做工作时来听的水平（还有淡淡的忧伤）。
最有趣的是画面，全程没有出现所谓的现代主流的配置方式，全程下来之后会有种「一旦接受了这种设定，那很棒哦.jpg」不过在『创作理念』栏里作者也说了为什么会这样子去做，在看过 Extra Notes 之后，也能感觉到作者想要表达出一种和「其它的」并不一样的东西。

记录之外：
水仙是听过很多人说过，但是一直没有去玩，因为种种偶然这次推了下，目前在用的公交塑料卡套就是水仙的（projectlights），嘛，其实最主要还是想看一看剧情到底是什么样子就是……关于医院中的病人在做什么事情，最终还是取决于自身所拥有的「自由」与「希望」，大概对窝来说，主题就是这样，以上。（至于中间出现的那种让自己时不时想起也想做类似的小动作，甚至能让自己稍微激动下的地方也是まじやばくね。）

29851443.review:
I finished reading the Visual Novel for the first time on my PSP when I was looking for  a good ported VN for PSP. I was so drawn into the story that somehow my depression suddenly vanishes and gives me a new reason to live my not so good life. Narcissu is a story about terminally-ill people who somehow, even though there's no more hope in their life, carried to do something that every terminally-ill people want to do. And that is to die where they want to die.

I bought the copy of the Light Novel in my own language when it was on sale on some local anime convention. And I can proudly say that Narcissu is one of the best linear VN out there that's also great for people who want to play VN for the first time. I bought the 10th Anniversary Anthology Project because I want to support the developer to make a jewel that is on par with Narcissu.

In short, Narcissu are one of those story that can change your life forever.

29721556.review:
个人Steam上第一款全成就的游戏 ——《Narcissu》（水仙），一个关于2个人，15天，960km旅程的故事，一个平静而又普通的故事，一个感（zhi）人（yu）至深的故事。此时此刻，在地球的另一边，淡路岛上的水仙如今正在灿烂地绽放吧。

《水仙》应该是这两年我看过最打动人心的短篇小说（我一直不把这类游戏视为“游戏”），放在文学领域这也是短篇小说中的精品。搭配文字的BGM满分，可以说视觉小说是文学、音乐和绘画三类艺术的完美结合。这其中的体验就好像是你一边看带有插画的小说一边听轻音乐。一个人在夜晚静静地看完这部作品是最好的，故事只是平静地描述一个平凡女子最后的人生旅程，其中没有出现痛哭流泪的场景，只是淡淡叙述娓娓道来，更能引发读者对于生命的思考。这样的故事并不特别，然而却意外地打动人。满分的音乐配上忧伤的文字，看完之后有种说不出的惆怅感。后来查了一下才知道作者片冈智晴是根据自己身边发生真实事件改编的，果然艺术都是源于生活而高于生活啊。

翻了好久的测评也没有看到这篇自述式散文，这里就贴一下链接。文章是片冈写在ラムネ （ http://bgm.tv/subject/2358 ） 的staffroom里面的，由bangumi ID：七文（R大）翻译，原文链接： http://bgm.tv/blog/47028

散文回忆了1980年发生在作者身边的一些事情。当时片冈13岁，里面出现的S美是《水仙》女主濑津美的原型。另外怕会影响理解这里说明一下，片冈的全名是Kataoka Tomo，文中S美对他的称呼从K到T是一种变得亲近的表现。

29133307.review:
Now then, on all accounts, I couldn't call this a game. There are no choices that you can make, and there is only one ending to these stories. However, this is certainly worth your time if you like Visual Novels. A must read.

The voice actors and actresses are excellent. Their performances often drove me to tears. Not just one time, but again and again. That's pretty rare for a Visual Novel to really hit home with me. Almost all of the characters feel like real people instead of cookie-cutter tropes.

I find it to be an interesting stylistic choice to have the images usually taking up less than half the screen, and have hardly any images of the characters show up. Despite the fact that I have played a great number of games and Visual Novels, I don't think I've ever seen that before. I think it helps to add to that feeling of being trapped or having no choice, which is what all of the main characters expirence.

Even the little details of the game itself help to drive the point home. From the fact that, when this Visual Novel has been windowed, it measures exactly 15 centimeters. That is the widest the windows on the seventh floor can be opened. It gives the feeling of an outsider looking in or an insider looking out. I think it symbolizes both.

Art: 7/10 (This might be a weird thing to say, but the characters sometimes look to damn adorable to fit the mood of the story. It sometimes distracted me from being properly sad.)
Characterization: 8/10
Concept: 8/10
Music: 6/10 (Lots of songs were reused in Narcissu 1&2, and they have a tendency to loop over and over again)
Originality: 7/10
Plot: 8/10
Replay Value: 2/10 (Maybe if you want to cry some more or look into the stories that are mentioned in the Visual Novel to get a better understanding, but otherwise...)
Voice Acting: 9/10
Overall: 7/10
Would Recommend To: Anyone who likes Visual Novels and sad stories

29023941.review: Naricasu was one of my favourite animes in the entire world. I am a huge light novel reader and have read many editions of "Cory in the house". I believe that this takes Cory in the House to a whole new level. Cory Baxter was my idol all through my adolescent years as I was beginning to experience change. Cory's struggles with the presidents daughter always led me to think... why? Why... The thought that goes into everyones mind while reading/watching the show(only hardcore Cory lovers read the novels)... But thats when it came to me. Naricasu. The same writer as the writer of the Cory in the House novels. Naricasu was made FOR Cory in the house! All the evidence is here... Naricasu makes you think of Cory, and Cory makes you wonder why... Why... 3 letters in why... 3 sides of a triangle... ILLUMINATI? No, it couldnt be... But now that Im thinking about it, it all makes sense... the evidence was in front of our face the entire time and we didnt even know it! Cory is black. 5 letters in black... 5 + 5 gives us 10... 10 letters in Illuminati! Still not convinced? I wasn't either. But this last fact will surely make you believe me. NARICASU rhymes with DONT EAT MY SOUP... Dont eat my soup rhymes with hoola hoop... Yes, this is surely the final step... If we take the word HOOLA and take away the letters H, O, O, L, and A away, and then write hte word ILLUMINATI, we get the word, ILLUMINATI. Coincidence? I think not.

29007909.review:
[h1] Добро пожаловать в «стерильно чистое, белое место, где потолок выше обычного, а окна открываются не более чем на пятнадцать сантиметров», именно тут всё и начнётся. [/h1]

[i] Всегда удивлялся тому, насколько сильно способна засесть в твоей голове какая-нибудь история, которую поместил туда абсолютно посторонний человек, а возможно и целая группа людей.
Как? Задаст абсолютно любой человек такой вопрос. А всё очень просто, нужно лишь быть искренним, любить то, что ты делаешь и вложить частичку себя. [/i]

[i] Stage-nana обычные разработчики, которые выпустили в 2007 году заурядную, на первый взгляд, кинетическую новеллу.
Они оперировали саундтреком, небольшим объемом текста и довольно не прогрессивной графической составляющей, на тот момент.
Но у них, в отличии от множества других разработчиков, настолько сильно удалось поместить в мою голову столько тепла, приятных воспоминаний и желания каждый раз сравнивать какой-нибудь похожий продукт с их продуктом, даже после длительного промежутка времени, что у меня просто не поднимается рука написать что-то в их сторону кроме положительных слов и пожеланий. [/i]
[b] Но я попробую быть объективным. [/b]

[i] Сюжет в Нарциссах повествует о двух больных людях, девушке и парне, которые покорно ожидают свою неизбежную смерть, в следствии поставленных неутешительных диагнозов, на белых и стерильных просторах, особого, 7 этажа в больнице, или дома, просиживая всё время в своей комнате. Но что-то происходит и ситуация кардинально меняется. [/i]

[i] Графическая составляющая, как я писал выше, на действительно посредственном уровне. Но на то время она считалась вполне смотрибельной, тот же планетарий от студии "Key" сделан в похожем стиле, но оба продукта безумно привлекательные. [/i]

[i] Безумно обожаю саундтрек из этой игры, он буквально пронизывает тебя самыми разношерстными эмоциями, заставляя переживать, радоваться, смеяться, словно именно ты главный герой или героиня.
21 композиция заставит вас ещё долго реветь в подушку после чтения данной новеллы, а возможно даже и подтолкнёт купить саундтрек в стиме. [/i]

[i] Текстовая составляющая выполнена на уровне, русского языка в самом стиме нет, но есть замечательный перевод на главную часть данной новеллы. [/i]

[b] Narcissu замечательная история, которая способна подарить вам целую жизнь, полную горечи и радости, всего за один вечер. [/b]

28691717.review:
tldr: Narcissu is made of feels.

Do you wish to die alone, or to burden those who care about you with your passing? It is sad, but we are all mortal, and we will all die. This is the story of people waiting for inevitable death, their struggle and their heartwarming strength to try and accept this. It is a story of life, but not all lives are long.

Narcissu is not a story of tragedy: It is not a story made to hurt you but it will hurt. You will cry but they will not only be tears of sadness. It will fill you with (platonic) love, loss, and acceptance.

在接触这个游戏之前我的人生都是白过的吧
大概

那时候因为父母经常为了小事吵架
并且将事情的原委都丢在我们兄弟身上
有一天将一切怪罪到哥哥的成绩不乐观和学费上
也许是一时冲动脱口的吧
我们就开始自暴自弃闭门不出
拒绝和父母交流
这游戏也许是我人生的救赎
因为这个游戏我们开始愿意和父母谈话
哥哥复学了我因为跟不上课程虽然可以勉强及格
但是我明知自己的程度不想浪费学费而弃学
也想过出去打拼但是被十分反对现在留在了母亲的身边
水仙2因为乱码所以没能接下来看剧情感觉可惜
一开始比较自卑的我第一次觉得在这个世界上活下去
是多么幸福的事情
有种说不出来的感觉
就只是活着就感到幸福
故事不是很长游戏采用视觉小说的方式叙述故事
这只有不到500mb的游戏十分沉重

请不要为了一个免费的成就跳过

开车到了非常非常远的地方
这段令人感触颇深
[被留下来的人应该怎么做]
这是每个想着舍弃生命的人都该思考的事情
不要对一切感到绝望
即使辛苦活下去总会有明天
最后是个人感想
BGM给我深刻的印象就是伤感和欢快的共鸣
我最喜欢的几个篇章应该是ver.2第18章的为了谁和19的魔法了

姫子为了被留下的人留下了愿望

留下来的也许不会是希望

总的来说这是前两章是作者对自杀者的感伤

而3rd应该是想给笔下人物一个选择的权利
也许不是一个好的结局
也许和第一二章的剧情出现了矛盾

在最后希望大家一直像濑津美一样能微笑着面对一切

28545076.review:
淡淡忧伤触及心弦到想哭的作品！上古催泪弹
和星之梦同一时代的轻小说AVG，当时仅BGM无音效、无OST的遗憾现在也得到了满足。不得不说，看到标题的一刹啥是激动的，又有点感叹岁月时间流逝，现在很少时间可以尽情沉浸在这样淡淡故事中回忆了。
回到游戏，这部作品叙事风格比较清新，[spoiler] 主人公（还有世界？）虽然身患绝症，但仍然带有些许无奈暖的过着剩余的日子。有种对生命的向往和对自由的追求，看完之后嘴角带笑之余仍然有一抹无法擦拭的淡淡忧伤。[/spoiler]很喜欢的情节，整个小说剧情不长，差不多5个小时的文字量，没有分支可选、没有波澜壮阔的争执和转折，但不失为一份体验生活之美的作品。
1相对2个人觉得更为经典，但是2的剧情更丰富，而且这次2里面的插曲（在Chapter4最后，就是游戏介绍的那首曲子），简直完美！强烈推荐买OST。英语翻译只尝试了第一个，感觉已经很到位了，所以没有对第二个翻译版本进行确定，应该都是不错的。

28522093.review:
Bueno primero que todo, esta novela lo que tiene de bueno principalmente, es que es gratuita, ya que no hay que pagar absolutamente nada, y NO es una demo y un free to play, sino una novela visual completa. como es una novela visual, obiamente este clase de juego solo les gustara a los otakus o amantes del anime, que seria mi caso.

La historia es algo melanconica, pues no es una novela de comedia, ni de ecchi, sino una de del genero recuerdos de la vida, ya que es una historia nos puede pasar a cualquiera, y lo unico que tienes que hacer es hacer clip y dejar que los personajes te cuente la historia del juego, nada mas, esta novelas solo tiene una ruta unica, por el cual no busques formas de cambiar la historia, pues no se podra.

en cuanto la parte tecnica, lo nueno es que son 2 novelas en una, pero lo malo es que esta en ingles, por el cual debes dominar un ingles basico/intermedia para entender la historia, tambien sirve como escusa para mejorar tu ingles, aunque la comunidad tiene un parcher para traducir el primer juego al español, lamentablemete para el segundo juego no hay.

en conclusion esta novela se lleva una nota de 5/10 y nada mas, no es videojuego hardcore, sino una simpre novela para relajarse y difrutar de una gran historia y derramar lagrimas

The game is amateurish if matched it to most modern VNs, but the story was strong and meaningful. 28350708.review:
[h1]More the fool, I.[/h1]

So there I was in the wee small hours of the morning rubbing my sleepy eyes and thinking that maybe I'd spend a few minutes with a visual novel before turning in. That's right. [b]More the fool, I.[/b] I was still awake hours later with moist eyes and pondering what I'd just experienced. Narcissu 1st & 2nd deals with death and dying and the unfair fate of being terminally ill and expiring young before having much of a chance at living. It's also about those left behind. It's a story ( a group of stories, really) that is very complex, yet told in a very simple and endearing way. It's easy to see what a labor of love this is for the author.

A few small pointers:
[list]
[*]Don't rush this one. Set aside some time and take it slow.
[*]It doesn't seem to matter what order it's read in, but understand that Narcissu 2nd is something of a prequel.
[*]As mentioned above, Narcissu 1st & 2nd deal with death. It may not be suitable for small children.
[/list]
[b]TL;DR   A very moving story about the terminally Ill. Highly recommended.[/b] 10/10.

28323676.review:
人类在命运的面前真的太过渺小，《水仙》，从这份渺小中诞生。
    当命运的不公强加在灵魂之上时，你的心将何去何从 ？
    我相信人类的灵魂永远向往自由，渴望"可以去任何想去的地方"，一开始主人公的双脚却紧紧的被命运的枷锁栓紧，如果没有女主，相信他会选择在7楼度过最后的人生。濑津美的出现，却摩擦出了不一样的火花，零零散散的对话，寂寥无比的空气，却成为了一种催化剂，使他们决定，对命运发起一次小小的抵抗，即使全身紧缚，也要戴着镣铐跳属于自己的舞蹈。一辆车，将近五万日元，一点药物，几件衣服，还有那提示着他们命运的手带，这点物资实在少的可怜，但是对于被夺走未来的他们而言，他们没有选择，只能在慌忙中逃离7F，毅然上路。数日奔波之后在桥上，两位相依为命的主人公，在路人的撮合下留下了他们来过这个世界的证明“尽管只是一次性相机，它也是我们所留下的痕迹。”我反对那个将本剧划为悲剧艺术并给出差评的那个测评，这个故事分明是在说两个年轻人互相取暖，不甘于随波逐流，力求寻找自己人生意义的故事，引用一个评论“当人生有了目标时，生命的意义就因此浮现。”而濑津美在人生最后的960km找到了自己的“家”，也感谢他在这15天里，她点亮了主人公的人生。
    感谢《一号线》这首bgm，在我困惑于他们这样做是对是错时给予我答案，也对于迷茫于未来的我亮起了灯塔：既然未来无法改变，既然人生没有方向，何不自己寻找，自己赋予自己意义？这句话对于任何一个二十岁的年轻人都是适用的，二十岁，我们与社会并没有什么接触，对于未来也是迷雾重重，即使没有未来的人都能自己思考自己为何立足于天地之间，普通的人又怎能不拼命思考，坚定自己的信念，放手一搏，不然对于可怜的他们，岂不是太过不公？努力拼搏吧，身心健全的我们，不要畏惧于失败就驻足不前，不要怯懦于挫折就浑浑噩噩，我相信每个人心中都有属于自己的淡路岛，即使没有，也要去找，至少先迈开步伐，在磕磕绊绊中摸索未来的方向，在失意迷茫间争取自己的价值，在我们生活过的世界里留下自己的印记。
“如果我就这样走入大海，你会拉住我吗？”，一开始濑津美这么问男主的时候我认为她是希望男主拉住她的，她想活着，她有太多遗憾，遗憾于自己的人生还没开始就要结束，遗憾于自己只能了解公路的知识，只能掌握车辆的知识，只能熟稔花卉的知识，只能在海报上看着不认识的美女摆着可爱的姿势，然而自己永远无法自己去体会，遗憾于自己的世界与外界完全割裂开来，在那电视机前，在那只能打开15cm的恍惚面前。然而在这15天中，她走上了向往已久的公路，亲眼看到了只有书本中有的汽车，甚至拿到了“驾照”，在那960km以外的Narcissus中畅游，她的人生目标，至少完成了一些，哪怕在常人眼里看来无比渺小。最后一次问男主“如果我就这样走入大海，你会拉住我吗？”时，男主问她“希望我拉住你吗？”时，答案呼之欲出。在唯美的水仙花海，故事画上了完美的句号，不用回忆杀，不用后日谈，这样就好。
    “黎明很快就要来了。”
     ps,我不愿测评cg和立绘，作者有意图的淡化这些概念，甚至可以voice off，只希望读者们可以静下心，在浮躁的生活中，花一两个小时的时间，在《一号线》的公路音乐中，陪伴他们，走完这960km，同时问问自己“我的明天在哪里？”

28291290.review: This may be a bias since I'm into these sort of stories, but really, it's marvelous. Simply amazing.

28288838.review:
"Well then, one last thing"
"...Smile for me. Setsumi..."
-------------------------------------------
水仙是一部很出色的小品作，各种意义上。
它不是gal，没有华丽的cg，没有豪华的声优阵容，也没有丰富的可攻略的角色。它只是一个视觉小说，只有一些简陋的背景画，只有不算特色但是有在努力演出的配音，还有一个性格有些孤僻的女主，适合在安静的环境下慢慢看完。不过，它的音乐倒是相当出色了，甚至能算上这部作品的核心之一。
其实在我看来，水仙的剧情并不算得上很出色，从主人公的旅程开始到结束，有些地方可能略显突兀，叙述也算不上精彩，但是表现力并不差，甚至其带给我的震撼不亚于eden这种作品。我觉得很大程度上归功于本作的独特切入视角——医院7楼的人。对这些原本过着普通生活的人来说，任何的情感价值，任何的未来理想在生死门前都显得过于苍白无力，这种无力感和人类对美好生活的向往和对希望的渴求形成巨大的反差，在这种矛盾的情况下，人们会怎样想，怎样做是水仙的精彩所在。
用这种独特的视角，细腻的心理描写，水仙展示了在死亡倒计时的情况下，主人公言行、性格、甚至价值观的突变，其中包括对通常所认为的“善良”的否定，对生活和命运的思考等等。
这个问题并不只是病人的事，同样也是一个社会问题。作者从一开始就给出的社会背景自杀数据，以及始终贯彻始终的对病人身边朋友、家人和所处环境的社会环境描写，都赋予了这个故事一定社会意义。
整个故事有些浪漫主义的感觉，结局也是一个十分浪漫主义的结局，我个人还是觉得不错的，女主转过身回应男主，脸上同时带着泪痕和笑靥这两种最美丽的面部表情，这一幕在我玩完后一直浮现在我眼前。没有eden那样撕心裂肺的诀别，但是这样的平淡中带着无比的感伤和震撼，可以称得上一个普通人的悲剧。
2代作品是1代的前传，是对1代中一些背景和细节的补充，使得1代故事更加完善，女主更加立体，不过在情感和表现力上不如1代了，感觉或许核心部分还是水仙1中的故事吧？

28264785.review:
----------内含少量剧透----------
本评测仅针对于『Narcssu』，『SIDE 2nd』、『3rd-Die Driette Welt-』都逊色于初代作品。綦尽其力，片岡とも在之前之后都再没有超越水仙的作品存在了，其后的『雨之边缘』套用了水仙的O.S.T.，不过其脚本过于随意，难以比肩水仙。为不影响对优秀初代的评价，分开测评是合理的。
水仙是我接触的比较早的一部ADV，虽然全程都没有选项，原画少的可怜，而且缺乏后期，游戏性几乎没有，各方面都勉强及格，但依然不妨碍一个好故事撑起整个游戏，或许称不上神作，但依然称得上是部佳作，没有Ifinity系列的Ever17、Never7，Muv-luv Alt-带给人的震撼，但一如车轮般匀速前进的情节，在一种静谧中走向终结，这足以致郁人好久，由故事更引出的关于社会与生死的思考，使得脚本创作具有同类型巅峰的素质。
经过了几度的芟繁就简，水仙的文本容量可谓简约。总的时间不超过两个小时，如果看得快的话一小时之内都可以推完，少有的极短的galgame。从故事最初浮现的自杀人数。便注定了这会是个悲剧，全篇的基调也是充斥悲伤，沉重，凝重以致绝望。
故事中讲到希腊神话中Narcssus少年的故事，Narcssus因为自己的美貌而坠河，Echo因为无法表白，凄美的声音在树林中回荡成echo。这让我想起Paulo Coelho『牧羊少年奇幻之旅』在楔子中对水仙男孩故事的引用，引自Oscar Wilde，河水哭泣注视着Narcssus眼睛里自己的倒影而忘了记下男孩的容貌。与自恋无关，『Narcssu』的故事同样在一种凄美中走向自灭，不过去掉了“s”(suicide)，淡路岛上的零落的水仙花，都表达着这种美。悲剧产生自历史必然的要求与这个要求实际上不可能实现（恩格斯），不过水仙的悲剧更多的是社会在此之上推波助澜，两度进入7F，最终让瀬津美走向了绝路。在旅途上阿东优的陪伴无疑是全篇最温馨的部分，虽然故事中瀬津美孤独造成了她琢磨不透的心思和与年龄不相仿佛的成熟，使得她给人的代入感薄弱。不过依然能从细节处发现她对男主的好感，最后的微笑更是故事最美的瞬间，瀬津美在微笑中释怀，结束了旅行，是故事的又一次升华，也是一种遗憾，教人扼腕。
日语推不动的话可以选择gp32译的，因为其在agilis之后并参考改进了后者，当然我们也可以等待官方汉化，或者直接上民间汉化的。这里给出Sekai Project Narcissu 10周年纪念众筹：
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/sekaiproject/narcissu-10th-anniversary-anthology-project
片岡とも在游戏中推荐不要开配音，并不是本篇的配音素质问题，而是瀬津美的声音抑制了情感表达，而且语速稍慢。靠脑补的话或许会有更细致的感触。
btw：瀬津美所患的不是囊性纤维变性(cystic fibrosis)而是某种心脏病。

26484780.review:
现代，黯淡的气息，即将面对死亡的男女主角……

平静，或许可以作为我对narcissu的一个注脚。在游戏的两小时中，2位主角几乎没有太过明显的情绪起伏，只是淡然地面对「死亡」这件事。因此，故事中 没有声嘶力竭的哭喊，也没有令人肝肠寸断的临别感言，更没有扭转情势的奇迹。玩家只是静静地看着濑津美走完人生的最后一程。

当一个人活着只是在等待死亡时，那会是什么样的感觉? 濑津美 8年来反覆地入院、出院，甚至2度住进象征“等死”的7F。如同她自己所说的，对她而言，时间早已静止，心也早已封闭。从最初开始，她就不抱着任何的希 望。因为当期望无法实现时，那种绝望会更加痛苦，与其这样，倒不如刚开始便放弃了。

于是，濑津美总是将“没什么”挂在嘴边，不在乎周围的一切，只是平静地活着。可以说濑津美从八年前便放弃了自己的生命。
整个故事的重头戏在主人公与濑津美长达960km的旅程。这也可以视为一个转机，让选择逃避的濑津美重新面对自己的人生。最初两人只是因为 不想留在医院与家里因此决定离开，然而却因此找到了新的生存目的—到淡路岛看水仙。故事中有一幕让我印象深刻，当两人决定要到淡路岛后，又在一处湖边休息，这时濑津美又像前次一样，走向水边问主人公如果她就这样走入水中，主人公会不会阻止她？而主人公的回答是，因为我知道我们要到淡路岛去，所以你是不会就这样走入水中的。当人生有了目标时，生命的意义就因此浮现。

到了淡路岛看到成片的水仙时，濑津美的目标达成了，而在这时，主人公终于听见了濑津美真正的心声。其实，濑津美后悔了，后悔自己为什么从一开始便选择放弃，只是这一切都已经太晚了，濑津美悔恨的泪水，可以说是本作情绪起伏最明显的桥段。
而最后，当目标已经达成，而没有新的、想达成的目标时，生命也渐渐走向尽头，因此，濑津美还是走向了自杀。只是与过去的她有所不同的是，她能带着些许幸福的记忆与笑容离开。整个故事就这样平静地结束。
结束960km的旅程 结束两人15天的旅程 也结束濑津美22年的旅程……

最后，我认为濑津美也好，主人公也好，之所以讨厌医院和家，或许就是因为他们的特别吧!由于他们是生命所剩无几的病人，所以大家对他们的态度都变了，他们已经无法再跟正常人一般地生活。7F便是他们与一般人不一样的象徵。可是实际上，他们却还是渴望能有一个跟普通人没两样的生活。因此，唯有将 濑津美从特别带入普通，我们才能看见真正的她，以及真正的笑容。而这些是只有将她视为普通女孩子的主人公才能看到的。不然，对於大多数的人来说，濑津美不过是个久病厌世的自杀者，甚至只是一年35000个自杀者之一罢了。我无意评断濑津美最后的决定是否正确，也无意讨论本作是否蕴 含社会批判，我只是单纯从故事中得到一些感动，也看到了一些希望。

narcissu与其说是游戏，倒不如说短篇电子小说。与商业作品不同的是，故事单纯却深刻，没有华丽的CG图，没有庞大的世界观设定，没有背负宿命的主角，更没有意有所指的说教。只是平静地描述一个平凡女子最后的人生旅程。这样的故事并不特别，然而却很真实。

26474056.review:
Narcissu is a kinetic novel (no choices, just reading) about several young people in a hospice (place for the terminally ill). As such, it is a fairly heavy story with none of the fan service/romance type of themes you might see in typical VNs.

I have to say that when I first started, I did not like the art and felt the game was confusing because you can't tell who is talking. The latter is because there is no sprite that shows up on the screen when someone is talking like in typical VNs. After finishing the game (about 4 hours total play time), those complaints are still there, but I was drawn in by the story. I think it is an interesting take on the philosophy of mortality. Just one of those games where you can think about it afterwards and decide whether it makes sense for you or not.

If you are into VNs I think it is worth a couple hours, especially since it is free. 

Tip: When you start a game, it will let you choose between launch screens. It is not obvious that you are actually picking between 1st or 2nd since there is no labeling. You should be playing 1st before 2nd for proper story continuity. You want the left screen for 1st, or right screen for 2nd. If you start the game and it talks about a boy, then you are in 1st. If you start and it takes about a family of girls, you are in 2nd.

26227850.review:
NOTE: I will ONLY be talking about the first story, and not the second.


I am very conflicted with this visual novel.
On one hand, I can see and respect what the creators were trying to do here, and I like the overall tone of the story. 
It's usually hard for me to get into visual novels, but this particular one grabbed my interest from the start with its tragic story.
But on the other hand, there are many things that hold this visual novel back.

Its major flaw is just how short it is. If you're dedicated, you can finish it in an hour or two, which really takes away some potential. 
The overall story is good as a whole, but it just ends in such an abrupt fashion, and the characters themselves aren't as developed as they could be.
I am aware that the 2nd story improves on this for Setsumi, but not so much for the male protagonist. 
The beginning of the story describes him as a sick individual, constantly being readmitted to the hospital. While it does go somewhat into detail about his life, it doesn't do so as much as it should've. 
It talks briefly about his friends, family, and health, and then bam, we learn that he's going to soon perish.
For us to feel more sorry for this character, more backstory and interactions would've greatly helped.
This visual novel went too fast into its main story without thinking about its characters, and that's a huge problem considering that there are really only two characters to follow and care about.
When you have such a small cast of characters, you really need to work hard in giving them as much depth and history as possible, and show a lot of development. Granted, there was not much development to be shown here, but they did indeed waste potential on giving them more depth nonetheless.  

The most interesting part of this visual novel was indeed Setsumi. She had a mysterious quality to her, and she helped kept me reading, as I really wanted to know more about her.
But sadly, I didn't get to know too much about her character in the first story, but it was still more than what I got with the male protagonist.

And on another note, I know this may be a nitpick, but at the end, I was starting to feel really sorry for Setsumi, and I would have felt even more sorry for her... If it wasn't for the sudden happy-ish sounding music in the background ruining the mood. 
I think I know what they were going for there, but it really didn't work. It just took away the amount of emotion that I could have potentially felt. That music definitely wasn't the right thing to play at a very serious and depressing scene such as that.
I've heard happy-ish music play in sad scenes before in anime, and most of the time it works, but here... Not so much, especially since it just ended so suddenly.
The ending really felt rushed to me. In fact, a lot of the story did. 
To me, it felt like the visual novel didn't know what to do.
At some parts, it really took its time in explaining everything, but in other areas, it seemed to be in a hurry to cram stuff in for whatever reason. I mean, it's a visual novel. They're known to be long, so there was no limit here. They could've taken all the time they liked with this in making the story longer, and thus, making it more engaging with more details, but the whole thing just feels as if the visual novel was being rushed to fit some sort of imaginary deadline.

In conclusion, I really liked this visual novel at first, but over time my interest dwindled, to where Setsumi was the sole reason I continued reading.
I felt some hints of sad emotions occasionally, but not nearly as much as other people. I feel as if I would have felt more emotions if I had more time to actually do so.

-- PROS --
* Good soundtrack that mostly succeeds in fitting and even adding on to the mood. (except for in the end)
* The limited CG's that were shown were very well drawn, although a few more of Setsumi wouldn't have hurt.
* The voice acting of Setsumi was pretty decent.
* Both of the English translations were very well done. While both had differences, they both managed to keep the feel of the story.

-- CONS --
* It was sometimes hard to tell which character was speaking. (I am aware that the voice acting helped, but if you don't enable the voices, it may be a nightmare to tell who's speaking)
* The characters had a huge lack of depth.
* The pacing was inconsistent.
* The ending was very abrupt and disappointing.
* Too short for its own good.

While I did enjoy this game in some ways, I was very disappointed in many other ways. 
I know that this is a free visual novel, but so was Katawa Shoujo, and look at how great that was. In my opinion, being free is no excuse.

While I personally did not enjoy this visual novel as many others did, I do not hate it. There are certainly some good qualities.

I would recommend this visual novel to people who just want a short little game to play to pass the time if you don't really care about the depth of the story or characters.
But in any other case, I'd say to stay away.

26198142.review:
A sad but powerful tale that describes the very real despair and pain of terminal illness patients who have to deal with their impending doom, their feeling of powerlessness, and how they hope to cope with it all.

I'd definitely recommend the first one, and even though the second one helps understand why one of the characters in the first story is the way she is, I thought it took way too long. I liked both, but if I only had Narcissu 1st I wouldn't have complained.

Yeah, definitely check this out. But if you're doing this in one sitting, like I have, make sure to lighten up your mood afterwards. And appreciate life and all it has to offer.

Hace aproximadamente un año me leí la primera novela, y aunque en comparación de otras pueda pecar de "simple" es realmente bonita y emotiva, no es que se haya convertido de mis favoritas ni mucho menos pero es realmente recomendable de leer al ser corta y sobre todo gratuita. Este tipo de historia agradará especialmente a quienes busquen una historia cargada de sentimientos, y esta ocasión tambien con una pizca de crueldad, o dicho de otra manera, realidad.

La segunda novela visual (que viene a ser precuela de la anteriormente nombrada) si al principio me pareció aburrida en comparación con la primera, la segunda mitad me pareció muy pero que muy buena, incluso me hizo llorar en cierto punto. Es una lástima que la primera parte se me hiciera cuesta arriba en algún momento pero me alegro de haber continuado leyendo aún así. 

¿Recomiendo Narcissu 1st y 2nd? Sí, si buscas un tipo de novela visual tranquila y emotiva, ambas historias cumplirán bien su cometido, además de que siendo gratuitas no hay excusas para, al menos, dar una oportunidad.

My stats seem to be a bit broken for this one since I didn't have Steam open while I read through it but, I truly enjoyed this VN.  I tend to like VN's that get an emotional response from me and, even though the author said that he was trying to avoid doing so, he got one from me.

I still remember when I originally read Narcissu 1st back in 2005.  It hit me hard (whenever a novel of any kind opens up with suicide statistics you know you're in for an emotional ride) but, Side 2nd really fleshed out Setsumi's character in a nice way.  The epilogue even gives us closure for our unnamed reader surrogate protagonist from the first novel which really helped me tie up the loose ends in my mind.

With this being free too, it's an easy recommendation for anyone who enjoys this medium.

25357044.review: Playing Narcissu is like entering a ring with a professional boxer. Prepare for emotional blow after blow, even when your eyes are swollen and weeping you stay in the ring until the very end. Better have the tissues near. Although the 2nd comes chronologically first I recommend playing 1st then 2nd. 1st helps get you into the world and tells a short sad sweet (albiet slow) story. 2nd is about twice as long and really gets you into the depth of the story of the true protagonists. Well written and nicely acted. Very nicely illustrated backgrounds and lovely if sparse character artwork. One minor complaint in the unrealistic nature of certain part (particularly the journey time in the first part) but if you can quiet the mathematical extreme logical part of your brain and just enjoy the emotional narative Narcissu is well worth the read.

24939967.review:
Note: I've only finished Narcissu 1st and I'm working on 2nd. Will update review once I finish 2nd. 

This VN has surpassed my expectations, especially for it being a free download (a rarity on Steam and for a VN). Some people mentioned that it's really dated, and I do agree, but it's not a bad thing. The simple graphics and artwork make you appreciate the story more, and leaves everything more to your imagination. The soundrack so far has been amazing, and ties very well with the very melancholy/gloomy mood that 1st is set in. I have a feeling that the majority of my gameplay time will be just listening to the OST. The story was drawn out, but I think that was for the better as well. It allowed you time to connect and sympathize with Setsumi and the Protagonist. I knew what to expect with the ending, as it's typical with Japanese stories and VNs in particular, but man, that ending hit me hard. Tears weren't really shed, but the feels did hit me once I realized what happened. 

A very thought-provoking story, and I highly recommend it. Even if you aren't into the VNs, each story takes only a few hours to complete (Narcissu 1st can be completed in one sitting). Definitely worth the download. Read Narcissu 1st first voiced with English subs if you want to get the best experience.

10/10 would get the feels again.

24698122.review:
(This review is only about Narcissu 1st, as I have not played the second one yet)

I went into this game with very low expectations, I believe because I stumbled upon a bunch of negative reviews that sounded really reasonable.

My criticisms are basically only about the presentation. Contrary to what you'd read in other reviews, it's not because it's too minimalistic: I respect a conscious decision by a developer, and some people (me included) might even like the approach. My problem is that whoever made this VN has contradicted themselves with weird design choices: judging by the in-game commentary, it seems that the intent of the game was to leave most things up to the player's imagination, and they couldn't decide wether the game had to have voice acting or not, so they gave you the option to choose.

This would have been absolutely the right choice, if it weren't for the fact that the game has the actual characters appear, even if just once or twice throughout the whole VN, which to me completely negates the whole "I want you to imagine it" experimental book approach. It's either contradictory, or I didn't get what the author meant, or he was just referring to imagining the characters voices?

Anyway, all of that is nothing more than a minor complaint: especially for a free game, the story dealt with such a heavy theme in a way that would result "boring" only to people who failed to read between the lines, and truth be told the story and character development is not even that subtle (including having some occasional moe-y tropes, but rare and well placed, and this is coming from someone who doesn't like that kind of thing), yet in its "light" approach it manages not to neglect the serious theme that is being used. In a way, the premise itself is what makes you see such a sequence of seemingly mundane events in an entirely different way. ...actually, that's probably pretty much the whole point of the VN and I'm just stating the obvious because I'm dumb.

Difficult to say why I liked it so much. I suppose the theme of what to do when going towards certian death has always fascinated me (in fact, I tried this VN to study how other authors approached this theme, since I am writing something with that theme myself), and that kept me in a constant state of... not tension, but something like that? Another term that right now I can't find, something that has more to do with dread and bittersweetness.

It's a small game dealing with a big theme and it definitely surpassed my expectations: definitely struck a chord with someone like me who is usually not very emotional, so I'd say give it a try. Best experienced when in the right mood.

Another minor criticism: the ending (when the male character speaks for the last time, not the "other character's ending" before that) was a bit clichè if not even cheesy, but at the very least still came off as emotionally touching as the rest of the game due to its context.

Is this what "visual novels" are? Absolutely ZERO gameplay, just some reading over pretty panels and to some touchy music here and there?

I'm sure there are many people who would like this, but this is not for me and I don't recommend it to anybody really. If I want to read, I read a proper book, and don't need pretty pictures or music for that, either.

I gave it an honest go, though; I did actually go through each story (granted, second time around was just excercise in clicking fast without even watching, just to get achievements) and even there, for me... it's rather 'meh'. Slowly paced stories about terminally ill people. Touchy-feely-artsy, eh?

I would rather play something like To The Moon, where it's touchy-feely, too, but at least more of a proper game... Brothers: Tale of Two Sons another great touchy-feely game but leveraging the medium of a video game... Heck, I would even recommend more something like Dear Esther or Gone Home for walking simluations.

24272143.review:
Fantastic, nihilistic entry level visual novels. While available for ten years prior to this, the port is free of any flaws, has multiple translations available and has optional voice acting. The dojin group that made these games, “Stage-Nana” got a lot of mileage out of the relatively few art assets in the game, and tell an impact story without being pretentious (which, considering the subject material is damn hard). 

Unlike other visual novels, there isn’t really an option to input any “choice” in the story, there’s no interaction from the player. I wouldn’t consider this a flaw, as the stories are short by comparison to other VN’s and it completely works for the type of story they’re trying to tell. 

Oh, and it’s free. So there’s that. If you dig visual novels, or thought The Antler’s “Hospice” was a bit too upbeat for you, give this a go.

on that very day of winter

23682091.review:
You may have wondered sometimes what's the meaning of life. This question takes a whole other sense when you'll die young and you're aware of it. Narcissu explores this theme, the fatality of death, and it does it very well. 

Both games are heavy, but the second one is somewhat a little more light-hearted. The characters have more personality and more drive, and one of the protagonists even manages to be funny, or at least tries to. However, both are beautiful stories. They show people trying to make the most of their life despite how short it will be, and despite how sick and weak they will have to face it.

Even though those are very sad stories that made me feel down, I enjoyed them and recommend to read them to anyone interested in dark stories that make you reflect on life and the absurdity of it. Aftwerwards, it made me feel good and optimistic: yes, there will be a point in my life where I have few things I'll be able to do in my remaining time like the characters in Narcissu, but contrary to them, I have the chance to live a fulfilling life filled with many experiences until then. I hope that's how you'll take it too.

23653485.review:
As much as I like visual novels, I can't bring myself to recommend this game with anyone. The plot is very slow moving, the characters aren't very likeable, and the 'save' function caused me to drop this game permanently. There was definitely potential for this game and a great idea, but the execution failed to make an impact.

Pros:
- The plot is makes sense with minimal plot holes. Doesn't leave the reader with many questions
- The audio clips were appropriate
- There were no bugs or lag in my playthrough
- The imagry was executed very well, all of the images for the background were beautifully drawn
- Appropriate audio clips were played when a character needed to perform an action

Cons:
- There was no autosave function, which might not be a big complaint for most people, but I forgot to save and closed the game 50 minutes in
- The plot was very slow moving, if you can't handle turtle-paced execution and slow character development, this is not the game for you.
- The looping soundtrack was distracting, especially when the audio cut and replayed
- The text scrolled really slowly
- Again regarding the plot, the goal that the two patients were aiming for seemed forced, like it was just to keep the story running 

I gave up on this game when I got to the seashore, accidentally closed the application, and was forced to restart all over (the game does not allow you to start a story from a certain chapter/checkpoint if you haven't saved). I found the plot uninteresting and boring after a while and could not find the motivation to pick it up again. While this may be a great game to fall asleep with, I can not recommend it even if it is free.

23552787.review:
[h1] << Narcissu 1st & 2nd - последний путь >> [/h1]

[H1] Сюжет: [/h1]

Короткая и довольно грустная визуальная новелла, повествующая о неизлечимых девушке и парне. Повествование ведётся от  двух лиц: девушки - Сецуми и парня, имя которого неизвестно.  В сам сюжет же заложена идея несбывшийся мечты обречённых людей. Большая часть рассказа происходит в дороге, в которой, по воле возжелания свободы оказались герои.

[h1] Далее в деталях: [/h1]

Визуально, игра выглядела довольно скромно и мрачно, CG было не так много, как хотелось бы видеть.

Музыкальное сопровождение было спокойным и довольно точно подобраным, что поддерживало атмосферу новеллы.

Есть два варианта чтения (С озвучкой и без неё, но озвучивается только Сецуми). Новелла кинетическая, поэтому на сюжет нельзя будет повлиять. Также в новелле присутствует отступление от автора и даже переводчика (к слову, такое не часто встретишь). 

Чтение займёт не более 2-ух часов, но думаю их можно без зазрения совести потратить на столь занимательную новеллу. Так что, рекомендую к прочтению.
P.S. Потребуется русификатор.

23030462.review:
It's 02:00 and I just finished this for the second time in maybe 3 or 4 years. I never bothered to review it the first time though, because I wasn't sure how to put into words what I experienced. I still don't think I am.

Oddly, there's not a lot to say. This novel is profoundly beautiful in its minimalistic presentation, the way the characters (of which there's only really one) are conveyed is surprisingly simplistic, yet that's where a lot of the emotional impact comes from. 

It's strange, but your character themselves is more of a passive proxy for describing the futility and beauty of the last few days of someone's life. There isn't a major amount of dialog, but what little is there really serves to illustrate the feeling this someone experiences in their last few days alive; to die on 7F or at home. A last act of defiance.

Music is fantastic, very fitting with the rest of the novel in that it's melancholic, passive yet still powerful enough to pull you into the scene and hope for the best. Not a ton of scenes, but they aren't the focal point anyway; they don't even take up that much of the screen. Text is also presented well in a nice, minimalistic fashion, yet still descriptive enough to paint some really great imagery.

It's a really unique experience, but probably not something you want to read before going to a party or something. It's a beautiful short story. I wouldn't recommend this one if you're depressed though. There's not really a happy ending here, beyond the freedom of the last few days; you're probably just going to get upset.

22763730.review:
转自我在贴吧的测评
首先说说我是怎么遇上水仙的，有些说来话长，最早在B站上闲逛，看到一个视频，是一个日本的医生和他已经过世的妻子的故事，虽然只是把当时在论坛上的帖子配上音乐，但故事本身却感动了所有人，然后在这视频中有提到《仰望半月》这部作品，于是我就去看了这部作品，第一次对于以医院为舞台的故事有了感触，然后就摸到了仰望半月吧，进入水仙吧得说是因为雪儿姐和心雨姐的故事，我没有想到自己会在一个充满祝福的帖子的最后会看到这么残酷的结果，在被她们感动的同时，我想了解一下水仙这个作品。
1.关于濑津美，真正震撼到我的是濑津美最后选择走向大海，拉着她出逃的男主给了她些许早已失去的“期盼”，但现实却不给予她更多体味这份期盼的时间，不得不说是无奈是遗憾。我不想过多评价濑津美这个角色，因为她只是一个普通的病人，是所有在7楼的病人的代表，没有人知道姬子留下的话语和15岁那个夏天以后呆在医院的时间给濑津美产生了什么样的影响，因而我也说不出更多，就不再赘述

2.关于姬子。姬子这个角色无疑是2代的中心，姬子对于天主教，对于汽车，对于妹妹和朋友，对于濑津美，对于那个8岁的小女孩，这些故事构成了2代。要说姬子这个角色，最值得一说的是发生在她身上的变化，她因为小女孩而变成了“原”天主教徒，从结局来看，她对于神的怨恨，对于自身信仰的放弃是对于现实的失望乃至绝望的表现，这一点从片冈的后记说明也看得出来。在描写姬子时，片冈无疑是明智的，他将15岁的濑津美作为和姬子互动的角色，这样一举两得同时丰满了两个角色，某种意义上，我很高兴姬子没有从富士山上一跃而下，虽然这么做可以与水仙1呼应，更显“轮回”（这个之后会提），但是可能与各人的承受力有关，我实在不想看到姬子也以这样的方式结束生命

3然后说说水仙本身，在通水仙1时，说实话我更多的感觉是淡淡的压抑，更像是一部纪录片。而水仙2则是确实的电影了。很多人抱怨水仙2虽然补完1的伏笔，揭开了所有铺垫（比如5万日圆和地图）但却有违和感。很简单，这就是用一部电影去补完一部纪录片所必然会出现的问题，但是片冈本人其实没有回避这个问题，在后记中他提出“骨”与"肉“的概念，2代的篇幅远大过1代，片冈也确实的连”骨屑“都没有放过。所以我认为，水仙1,2是必须放在一起评价的作品，把两部作品做比较就像是比较骨架和肉体哪个更重要一样毫无意义，当然这只是个人的看法

4关于文学性的问题，水仙是”暗流涌动“的故事，不管是不轻易透露感情的濑津美，强作微笑开朗的姬子，还是天真祈祷的小女孩。死神确实地追在她们的身后。也如你所说，矛盾是这样的故事的重中之重，我个人不认为小女孩的故事是”超越作品本身的亮点“，它很感人，但从全局而言，小女孩的故事更多的是用来在暗流之下埋藏矛盾。从实际的角度而言，一个8岁的小女孩能够像成人一样埋藏情感，”暗流涌动“这才更加不正常不是吗。简而言之，我认为小女孩的故事为整体服务的作用大过其本身的亮点，并未”越界”，这也是我接下来要说的

5水仙这部作品，个人认为有一个非常重要的”链“，就是轮回和延续，接上文所说，若是没有小女孩的故事，不仅这根链将不完整，姬子那“暗流”之下的“矛盾”也将消失，特别是在登山那段，两个故事不断穿插交替，凸显出“重叠”，这种呼应不可缺少，小女孩的身影和话语，和手中的十字架乃至姬子有些发狠的对神说出的话语，缺一不可的将二代的高潮剧情托出，也强调了“轮回”，一代结尾说，“全日本的自杀者中”，而二代说“全世界的天主教徒中”，这一呼应使我确定了片冈的意图，7楼的人们身怀悲剧，却不得不不断目睹着更多的悲剧，家人朋友或是刻意疏远，或是在不知不觉中变得不知如何接近，这样离人悲伤唏嘘的轮回无奈地继续，有些人在这过程中成为尼洛，有些人则成为了阿洛伊斯，水仙纯洁独立，一花一世界，“艾歌们”却永远无法得到narcissus的回应，这不是信仰可以解决的，甚至会使一个虔诚的教徒的祈祷变为诅咒，也许这有些过激，但却很真实，更何况作为一部”临终关怀“系的作品，水仙确实是无比成功的。“让留下来的人笑着活下去”，这是濑津美的遗言，也是对于所有阿伊洛斯的最好慰藉


最后再度为7楼的人们和所有受到病痛折磨的人祈祷，希望他们能够早日康复，健康的人也请珍重身体，没有什么比一个好身体更为重要（10周年纪念版当然是买买买啊
